teal.ui.swing

Class JCollapsiblePane

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • teal.ui.swing.JCollapsiblePane
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class JCollapsiblePane
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Collapses or expands its content area with animation and fade in/fade out effects.
    Author:
    rbair (from the JDNC project)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  JCollapsiblePane.AnimationListener
      This class actual provides the animation support for scrolling up/down this component.
      private static class  JCollapsiblePane.AnimationParams
      Parameters controlling the animations
      static interface  JCollapsiblePane.JCollapsiblePaneContainer
      Tagging interface for containers in a JCollapsiblePane hierarchy who needs to be revalidated (invalidate/validate/repaint) when the pane is expanding or collapsing.
      private class  JCollapsiblePane.WrapperContainer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JCollapsiblePane()
      Constructs a new JCollapsiblePane with a JPanel as content pane and a vertical PercentLayout with a gap of 2 pixels as layout manager.

    • Method Detail

      • setAnimated

        public void setAnimated(boolean animated)
        If true, enables the animation when pane is collapsed/expanded. If false, animation is turned off.
        Parameters:
        animated -

      • isAnimated

        public boolean isAnimated()
        Returns:
        true if the pane is animated, false otherwise

      • setContentPane

        public void setContentPane(java.awt.Container contentPanel)
        Sets the content pane of this JCollapsiblePane. Components must be added to this content pane, not to the JCollapsiblePane.
        Parameters:
        contentPanel -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if contentPanel is null

        public java.awt.Container getContentPane()
        Returns:

      • isCollapsed

        public boolean isCollapsed()
        Returns:
        true if the pane is collapsed, false if expanded

      • setCollapsed

        public void setCollapsed(boolean val)
        If the component is collapsed and val is false, then this call scrolls down the JCollapsiblePane, such that the entire JCollapsiblePane will be visible. This also causes the content container to be faded in. However, if the component is expanded and val is true, then this call scrolls up the JCollapsiblePane. Also, this will cause the content container to be faded out. Note: the animation occurs only if isAnimated() returns true

      • getMinimumSize

        public java.awt.Dimension getMinimumSize()
        Overrides:
        getMinimumSize in class javax.swing.JComponent
